column4: is it possible to have 2 monitors in clone setup such that one has a higher actual resolution than the other, but they have the same virtual resolution?
i.e. one shows the entire screen, the other scrolls when you move your mouse to the top and bottom, left and right of the screen
i dont know, but it does sound like a cool idea
indeed.
i'm sure it's possible somehow
sure, the question is, how :)
i suspect it would involve (maybe among other things) creating a secondary screen section in xorg.conf, with the virtual desktop enabled
i'm not sure if you can have two active "Screen" sections in xorg.conf at the same time or not..
you can, but not in clone mode
as far as i can tell.  it works fine if i want two different displays.  but to have one cloned display, it only wants one screen section
oh, they act as expanded desktops or whatever?
no, just two separate desktops.
you can have one big desktop, that's called xinerama
what kind of vid card are you using?
intel 855gm
http://www.x.org/X11R6.8.2/doc/radeon.4.html go there and search for "MergedFB" ... it looks driver-specific for radeon but if it can do it im sure other drivers have similar options..
the i810 driver
yes, i saw that.  didn't think it would work for the i810 driver.
hmm all im seeing for mergedfb anywhere is for radeon and some mention of nvidia, matrox and SiS..
http://www.xfree86.org/current/i810.4.html  search for "Clone" ... not very descriptive but might be a step in the right direction
yes, clone works.  but that makes both screens the same resolution.  i want the laptop screen to have a virtual resolution that is the same as the LCD's actual resolution
yeah... it might just be an issue of whether or not the driver has that functionality..
right.
